bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Merritte W. Ireland, May 22, 1941

div1.p: Hench hopes to see Ireland in Cleveland when the Wyeth company will give a preview of their Walter Reed Yellow Fever painting.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Merritte W. Ireland, May 22, 1941
div1.p:
Thank you so much for your nice note. I hope
I will be seeing you at Cleveland, when the Wyeth people
give the preview of their Walter Reed Yellow Fever painting.
I

I am so sorry to know that General Kean has been
ill and hope it is not serious. I am afraid that the seven
hours' questioning that I gave him the day before our luncheon
may have tired him considerably. He is a wonderful man.

Let me say again how very pleased I was at the many
courtesies that you and General Kean showed me in Washington.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. General M. W. Ireland
1870 Wyoming Avenue
Washington, D. C.
